intro: Calceolaria linifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf toadflax, is a flowering plant native to South America. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. It produces small, pale yellow or greenish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Calceolaria linifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique floral structure and attractive foliage.
